name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

strengths: Lure forces opponent's benched Pokemon active
weaknesses: 4 energy for Fire Blast is expensive
synergies: Energy Retrieval - Recover discarded Fire Energy
Double Colorless Energy - Powers Lure quickly
Gust of Wind - Additional switching control
counters: Energy Removal - Slow down Fire Blast

competitiveHistory: Ninetales was a solid Fire-type option. Lure provided tactical switching similar to Gust of Wind but as an attack, allowing you to target vulnerable benched Pokemon. Fire Blast's 80 damage was powerful but the energy discard made it hard to sustain.

rulings.ruling: Lure can only be used if your opponent has Benched Pokemon.
The switch from Lure happens immediately, before checking for Knock Out.
You must discard a Fire Energy to use Fire Blast. You cannot use the attack if you cannot discard.
